node.title: Covid-19 update: 1901 new community cases in NZ
node.description: The number of new daily community cases of Covid-19 has fallen slightly from yesterday's record, with 1901 new cases reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Ukraine's president urges sanctions against Russia before possible invasion, not after
node.description: "You're telling me that it's 100% that the war will start in a couple of days. Then what [are you] waiting for?" said President Volodymyr Zelensky.

node.title: Black Caps thrash South Africa in first test
node.description: The Black Caps completed a one-sided demolition of a pitiful South Africa, winning the first test by an innings and 276 runs before lunch on day three on Saturday.

node.title: Modeling agent who was close to Jeffrey Epstein found dead in French jail
node.description: Victims of alleged abuse described shock and dismay that the agent, Jean-Luc Brunel, will never face trial.

node.title: Bear known as "Hank the Tank" breaks into another Lake Tahoe home
node.description: The bear has broken into dozens of homes and become quite a problem for locals.

node.title: Harris warns of "unprecedented" sanctions if Russia invades Ukraine
node.description: The potential Russian invasion of Ukraine​ is leading the Munich Security Conference in Germany, an annual event to prevent another war in Europe.

node.title: Russian-backed separatist leaders declare full military mobilization
node.description: Tensions continued to mount in the east of Ukraine on Saturday after reports of increased shelling in the region overnight.

node.title: Infant formula products in US recalled after possible contamination
node.description: Some brands of powdered infant formula, only available online to New Zealanders, are being recalled due to possible cronobacter and salmonella contamination.

node.title: Dazzling win for Chiefs in opener
node.description: The opening New Zealand game of the new Super Rugby Pacific season has gone in favour of the Chiefs in Queenstown, with the Waikato-side looking ahead to a positive 2022 campaign.

node.title: Clashes in Ottawa as police move in to end protest
node.description: Police have clashed with protesters in Canada's capital as they move to end an anti-vaccine mandate demonstration.

node.title: Wellington protest disruption: 'It's getting very trying on people'
node.description: Wellington shops face a crisis, university buildings have closed for eight weeks and Wellingtonians say they're sick of disruption from the protest at parliament.

node.title: Cut-off water supply in parts of Wellington due to return as pipe repaired
node.description: A broken pipe that cut off water to four Wellington suburbs has been fixed but the water will stay off until 11pm.

node.title: Recap: Super Rugby Pacific - Chiefs claim 26-16 victory over Highlanders
node.description: The Chiefs took on the Highlanders at the Wakatipu Rugby Club in Queenstown in the opening salvo of Super Rugby Pacific this afternoon. See how the action unfolded.

node.title: Ex-Black Cap returns to cricket field after 15 year absence
node.description: Former international cricketer Andrew Penn has returned to the field after more than 15 years and will this weekend open the batting in a rep Twenty20 tournament in Palmerston North. Audio

node.title: Rimutaka Prison escapee may have left Wellington - police
node.description: A prisoner has escaped from Rimutaka Prison, and police believe he may leave, or has already left, Wellington.

node.title: Former US cop sentenced to 2 years for Daunte Wright killing
node.description: A former US policewoman has been sentenced to two years for killing black motorist Daunte Wright during a traffic stop.

node.title: Hong Kong planning mandatory COVID testing for every resident
node.description: Hong Kong leaders are planning to mandate testing for the city's nearly 7.5 million residents to combat rising cases

node.title: Govt ramps up support for community connectors
node.description: The government is funding almost 200 more workers - known as community connectors - to help vulnerable whānau access what they need, and more money is being put into foodbanks.

node.title: Petrópolis: Hopes fade for survivors in flood-hit Brazil city
node.description: Alarms rang out across the Brazilian city of Petrópolis on Thursday, warning of more heavy rain to come after floods and landslides killed at least 117 people with more than 100 missing.

node.title: Auckland Harbour Bridge bike day, but no trial
node.description: A cycle and pedestrian lane trial for the Auckland Harbour Bridge has been blocked by Waka Kotahi NZTA, who is planning a celebratory bike ride instead.

node.title: Perth a ghost town as CBD braces for Covid-19 wave
node.description: In the Perth CBD, businesses are battening down to prepare for what they anticipate will be a coronavirus storm, after watching what happened to Melbourne and Sydney over the summer.

node.title: IOC concerned about Kamila Valieva's treatment
node.description: International Olympic Committee president calls out "chilling" treatment of Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva by her coach at Winter Olympics.

node.title: FDA recalls certain Family Dollar products in 6 states over rodent infestation at plant
node.description: The recall impacts stores in Alabama, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri and Tennessee, and products purchased between January 1, 2021, and today.

node.title: Four Wellington suburbs without water after pipeline breaks
node.description: Residents in four southern Wellington suburbs are expected to be without water for most of the day after a pipeline broke.

node.title: Wave tower damaged by cyclone Dovi being removed from Port Taranaki
node.description: Work is under way to remove a wave tower off Port Taranaki severely damaged during ex cyclone Dovi.

node.title: NYC mayor unveils plan to bar people from sheltering on subway trains
node.description: Residents could see changes as soon as next week, Adams said.

node.title: Cricket: Nicholls and Blundell push Black Caps towards quick victory over South Africa in first Test
node.description: New Zealand is closing in on a massive victory inside three days in the opening cricket Test against South Africa.

node.title: Biden: U.S. has reason to believe Russia has decided to invade Ukraine
node.description: The U.S. believes Russia is capable of attacking Ukraine any day.

node.title: Jobs for Nature: More than 5000 jobs and 3.2m plants so far
node.description: The Jobs for Nature Covid-19 recovery programme has sprouted into more than 5000 jobs and 3.2 million plants, the Conservation Minister says.

node.title: Auckland Covid-19 PCR tests taking up to five days to process
node.description: Covid-19 PCR test results are taking up to five days to process in Auckland, while Christchurch Hospital has an extra ward for Covid patients as Omicron numbers grow in the city.
